Zap labels

Removes labels, leaving unlabelled vectors as is. Use this if you want to simply drop all labelling from a data frame. Zapping labels from labelled_spss also removes user-defined missing values, replacing all with NAs.

zap_labels(x)

Arguments

x

A vector or data frame

See also

Other zappers: zap_empty, zap_formats, zap_widths

Examples

x1 <- labelled(1:5, c(good = 1, bad = 5))
x1
#> <Labelled integer>
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5
#> 
#> Labels:
#>  value label
#>      1  good
#>      5   bad
zap_labels(x1)
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 5

x2 <- labelled_spss(c(1:4, 9), c(good = 1, bad = 5), na_values = 9)
x2
#> <Labelled SPSS double>
#> [1] 1 2 3 4 9
#> Missing values: 9
#> 
#> Labels:
#>  value label
#>      1  good
#>      5   bad
zap_labels(x2)
#> [1]  1  2  3  4 NA

# zap_labels also works with data frames
df <- tibble::data_frame(x1, x2)
df
#> # A tibble: 5 x 2
#>          x1        x2
#>   <int+lbl> <dbl+lbl>
#> 1         1         1
#> 2         2         2
#> 3         3         3
#> 4         4         4
#> 5         5         9
zap_labels(df)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 2
#>      x1    x2
#>   <int> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1
#> 2     2     2
#> 3     3     3
#> 4     4     4
#> 5     5    NA
